See also: sofa, sofá, and sofà

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From French sofa and Italian sofa, from Arabic صُفَّة‎ (ṣuffa).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈzoːfa/
  • audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Sofa n (genitive Sofas, plural Sofas)

  1. sofa, couch (upholstered seat with a raised back and one or two raised ends, that accomodate at least two people)

Declension[edit]

Declension of Sofa
singularplural
indef.def.noundef.noun
nominativeeindasSofadieSofas
genitiveeinesdesSofasderSofas
dativeeinemdemSofadenSofas
accusativeeindasSofadieSofas

Synonyms[edit]

  • Couch

Further reading[edit]

  • Sofa in Duden online

Hunsrik[edit]

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /soˈfaː/

Noun[edit]

Sofa m (plural Sofas)

  1. sofa
